Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Sat Jun 18 05:45:32 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a personal hoverpallet, and a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a
gold fleur-de-lys in the center and thick gold fringe here.

with a quiet hiss of hydraulics.

What was once a feature of interstellar geography is now the name of an
alliance, and the heart of Fringe space can be found past this gateway. The tiny
station of Nuevo Laredo stands guard here.

seconds."
The sounds stop as the transfer ends.

could count on you to deliver quickly."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

Once the frontier of Known Space for many years, the Borderlands region is now a
settled area of space, though rather poor compared to most others. A handful of
beacons indicate the positions of clouds of debris, but a nearby star indicates
a solar system may also be in this cluster.

to and from deeper space.

and debris has been pulled in its wake, leaving a funnel-shaped void.

gen
General Sector Transmission
Communication Menu:
[1] Greetings.
[2] Farewell.

[4] Where are you bound?
[5] I am in distress.

[7] Ignore my target.
[8] Leave the sector for your own safety.
[9] I offer surrender.
[10] Surrender or I will attack.

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
Ly_l$P,x6{v*APIFvK@K>5$wLY>Gd6P2\Zqpzbd+
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2864 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Eastnortheast and Very Slightly Up."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

You hear metallic scraping as the transfer of the cargo begins.
[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Salvage Processing Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Kalliste". The organization has earned 1,418,708.58 credits.
You are charged less in taxes for transferring to a pilot-owned space station.
You have donated one piece of debris to the station's blast furnace.
You have been credited with 5,672,100.99 League credits for your find.
Your income is deferred until the temporary station's storage module is
transferred to a spaceport.
The sounds from the ship's hold cease as the cargo finishes transferring.
You have completed a mission! Return to the mission provider to get paid!

1
--
Salvage Outsider Wrecks
--
A patrol recently ran into a bunch of Outsider ships near Clarkson's Push.
The fighting's done, but the people in R&D think there might be something to
salvage from the wrecks.
Head out there and pick up 90,000 units from the wrecks and we'll see what we've
got.
--
ftl clarkson
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
Via general sector communication, Beacon B-31 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to Clarkson's Push."
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.

You activate the ultimate salvage sensor and begin scanning for chunks of
debris.

192000km at Sector Northeast and Down, a medium-sized Outsider starship wreck
(grade 60) at a range of 108000km at Sector Northeast and Down, a tiny asteroid
(grade 0) at a range of 156000km at Sector Northeast and Down, a tiny asteroid
(grade 10) at a range of 144000km at Sector Northeast and Down, a medium-sized
Outsider starship wreck (grade 60) at a range of 132000km at Sector Northeast
and Down, a medium-sized Outsider starship wreck (grade 60) at a range of
144000km at Sector Northeast and Up, and a tiny asteroid (grade 10) at a range
of 96000km at Sector Northeast and Up.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
?XMbrtHh?1[MTDK.I@VSu$Ci$0@mJDSo*vP6Z9S*
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2834 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Eastnortheast and Very Slightly Up."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Kalliste.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

changelog
Recent Minor Changes:
-----
Altered debris-burning stations to still award industry points for debris
donated to the burner, as players seem to expect.
   Posted 4 days, 12 hours, 28 minutes, and 2 seconds ago
-----
Fixed a display error that misreported the credit reward when submitting
artifacts individually.
   Posted 3 days, 11 hours, 5 minutes, and 44 seconds ago
-----
The way ships power up and down has been rewritten! This will make a number of
further changes much easier.
   Posted 30 minutes and 53 seconds ago
-----

Superconducting Sink for the four-person mule "Ground Trouble" on behalf of the
organization.
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Uhm? What upgrade was that?"
[Starseekers] Morris Corlew transmits, "The battery that I want so badly!"
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "Yeah."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "I am not quite familiar with that
battery."
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "I read about it in our guide."
[Starseekers] Morris Corlew transmits, "It's a nice one."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Uh, actually, no offense intended, but
revo is better."
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "Depends on what engine you put it with."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "All you need to upgrade, actually, are
the combat grid and the laser."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Maybe the hull."
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "One for beacons."
Shasta the big onyx soldier felo marches out.
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "How do you check the available space in
your docking bay?"
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "We have no engine that can hit that top
speed, charge has been reduced to half of what it was, combat grid recharges
about a lot slower and a wormhole jump will take about 2 and a half as much
energy as it did with the revo, tell me where it's better?"
[Tactical Communication] Kim Saunders transmits, "I was already on your list?"
[Newbie Help] Sean Sloan transmits, "In the control try docking."
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Yep."
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "Ok. Ok. You could've upgraded it then,
just saying."
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Thank you Sean!"
[Starseekers] Angel Martin snorts.
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Well, I could have, but you wanted to.
Still if you put a battery on it that makes the ship about half as effective as
before, don't you think I should point that out?"
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "I'll switch it back then. Give me a
moment."

Parallel TT Array for the four-person mule "Ground Trouble" on behalf of the
organization.
[Notification from Starseekers] Angel Martin has ordered Telex Defense
"Jackrabbit" Combat Accelerator for the four-person mule "Ground Trouble" on
behalf of the organization.
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "What you really still need is the eaos
hull plating, and then the lasers you find on Capella."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "With that, and the grid, the rest was
actually good."
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "Those take five seconds to fire."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "They do."
[Notification from Starseekers] Angel Martin has ordered EAOS Plasma Resistant
Plating for the four-person mule "Ground Trouble" on behalf of the organization.
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Not adviseable for gunships with 6 or 8
turrets in each room, but definitely adviseable for ships that have 2 turrets

peer out
You peer out...
[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" and the vostok-class
capsule "Shooting Star" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and up.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
A medium-sized semi-transparent bell-shaped creature with long dangling tendrils
and a blue glowing interior drifts slowly across the tank.

out of Orion."

ftl old earth
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
[Notification from Starseekers] Angel Martin has ordered Revo Applied Technology
Sink for the four-person mule "Ground Trouble" on behalf of the organization.
Via general sector communication, Old Earth transmits, "Greetings, William Dove!
Welcome to Old Earth Orbit!"

l me
Shule Elemmire
He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His shoulder-length, straight hair
is blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large
brownish fingernails.
 He is wearing a blue shipsuit with cobalt blue trim around the collar and cuffs
and a pair of light brown leather boots decorated with silver stars. He is also
wearing a keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone
holster, a gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL
communicator, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case,
and a backpack. His head, face, both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are left
uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "Morning Dove"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair and an improved temporary
wormhole drive here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north and south.
The target tracking array is now tracking the RATS heavy fighter "RATS Heavy
Fighter Epsilon-9122804".
Down. RATS Heavy Fighter Epsilon-9122804
/f
A loud klaxon sounds and red lights flash overhead as the ship enters red alert.
You hear a low hum as the ship's weapons are powered up.
You hear the sound of something violently drilling into the hull. The impact
seems slightly lessened by the ship's ablative armor.

peer out
You peer out...
[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The five-person strike gunboat "Morning Dove" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north and down.
peer s
You peer south...
[Starship "Morning Dove"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at The Torus; Dock Alpha.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair and an improved temporary
wormhole drive here.
Lily Kaise and Kim Saunders are standing here.
You can go north and south.
[Starseekers] Angel Martin transmits, "Hmm. Anything else?"
You hear hammering and the chatter of technicians outside as the spaceport
repairs the starship.
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "All clear."
[Starseekers] Kim Saunders transmits, "Think you've got it."
The starship transitions into another sector.
Kim Saunders strolls in from the south.
Kim Saunders strolls down.
The starship transitions into another sector.

[Starship "Morning Dove"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on yellow alert. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a swiveling black leather gunner's chair here.
You can go south and down.

[Mining Site (2, 1)]
This is a broad, unforgiving expanse of jagged rock and regolith. Lights shining
brightly from the nearby asteroid outpost are all that keep the surface from
being in total darkness. The light forms shadows with sharp edges, highlighting
every boulder and dangerous peak.

and out of the virtual environment.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Shooting Star, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl old earth
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
Via general sector communication, Old Earth transmits, "Greetings, Shooting
Star! Welcome to Old Earth Orbit!"

ftl new
The computer reports that the two-person hardened asteroid hauler "Devastating
Effect" has launched from Old Earth.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

Want to know if anyone's relaxing in a public venue? Check WHERE!
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
s
[Starship "Firestorm"; Engineering Room]
You see a large leather chair, an improved temporary wormhole drive, and an
improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and down.

A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Unreality
Programming 812. Welcome to New Earth Orbit."
[General Communication] Aisling the Fox transmits, "Keegan, did you get any
other Mutuality pilots other than myself and Pierre?"
[General Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Aisling, are there any
Mutuality pilots reliably active besides you and Pierre as of late? I have not
even seen Liam O'toole in some time."
eta
The ship's current engine speed is 5000 km/s.
At that speed, the ship will arrive at its current autopilot destination in
about 12.0 seconds.
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Welcome, courier ship. You are cleared
to land."
[General Communication] Melinda Michaels transmits, "I saw Liam not so long
ago."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
out
You scramble to your feet.
out
[Starship "Unreality Programming 812"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
You exit the ship.

You can go north, south, west, and down.

318" has jumped into the sector.
ftl escuintla
sit chair
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Greetings, Registered
Merchant 318! Welcome to New Earth Orbit!"
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
[General Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "A shame. I really wanted to ask
him something."
The station of Barnham's Redoubt floats here, once a privately-owned territory,
since annexed by the Fringe Worlds government.
Via general sector communication, Escuintla transmits, "Hello there, Unreality
Programming 812. Welcome to Escuintla Orbit."

y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Welcome, courier ship. You are cleared
to land."
deliver
You may not deliver while the ship is moving.
deliver
You hear a brief bustle of activity from the storage room as the cargo is
quickly removed from your ship.
The chronometer states in a monotone, "Total delivery time: 1 minute and 9
seconds."
The sounds stop as the transfer ends.
A cheerful voice comes over your courier radio, saying, "Great job!  We knew we
could count on you to deliver quickly."
tra gen Hello Mike.
[General Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "Hello Mike."
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

Flight control gives the ship launch clearance.
[General Communication] Corey Matthews transmits, "Heya Mike."
tra 1 Hello Demarco

[General Communication] Mike Marshall transmits, "Hey shule.. how goes it &
corey."
ftl new
tra gen It goes.
[General Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "It goes."
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
[General Communication] Aisling the Fox transmits, "Anfisa has been active as we
just returned from her fauna trip."
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

Programming 812. Welcome to New Earth Orbit."

You peer out...
[Starship Museum; Docking Bay]
You find yourself inside the large docking bay of the Starship Museum, which
seems to double as a lobby. Strategically-placed booths sell tickets to citizens
of every alliance. Large signs list the ticket prices, and state that starship
pilots get in free. Small children stare at you in awe, perhaps considering
their own dreams of becoming starship pilots, while worried parents pull them
further away from you. Researchers and people with an interest in such things
gather around the older starships, making sketches or making a note of every
reentry scorch mark or laser scar. Two large archways lead northwest and
northeast; however, the northeast archway is apparently considered an exit, and
entry is blocked. To the south is the entrance to the museum's ITPN station.
The one-person courier "Unreality Programming 812" is landed here.
You can go south and northwest.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
Flight control gives the ship launch clearance.

from the various starship systems.
launch

A loud klaxon sounds and red lights flash overhead as the ship enters red alert.
You hear a low hum as the ship's weapons are powered up.
A number of coherent beams of weaponized light flash by the window as the
starship shudders under laser fire.
The computer announces, "This ship has been hit by Allied Pirates starship
'Complain More About The Price Of Voicemail.'"

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

l
[Starship "Israel Hope"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, and a polished
rosewood bar here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a large leather couch.)

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Israel Hope, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
land
The starship is already moving.
land
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Israel Hope. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out
out
You scramble to your feet.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The five-person pulsar "Critical Strike" and the two-person hardened asteroid
hauler "Devastating Effect" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

You speak into the microphone.
You earn 4,000,000.00 AEU credits for a successful beacon drop, plus a kill
bonus of 2,250,000.00 AEU credits, plus an enemy magnitude bonus of 400,000.00
AEU credits.
You earn a bonus of 2,604,583.33 AEU credits for submitting information to a
battle analysis scanner on a temporary space station.
332,500.00 credits of your income have gone toward your organization.
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has gained 5,511,232.38 credits
for a submission from a battle analysis scanner on League Battle-Scanning
Nuclear Temporary Station involving the five-person pulsar "Critical Strike".
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.

powered down.

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see an overstuffed red chair here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north and south.

        A basic defense turret that fires simple slugs of metal.
    [3] Chaingun Turret      [Cost: 80] [Power: 8] [Drones: 1]
        Fires very quickly, good for fast-moving enemies.
    [4] Sharpshooter Turret  [Cost: 100] [Power: 8] [Drones: 1]
        Fires at a very long range with good damage, but at a slower rate.
PROCESSOR
    [5] Basic Ore Processor  [Cost: 80] [Power: 5] [Drones: 1]
        Processes ore into usable metals. [Process: 80]
    [6] Improved Ore Processor [Cost: 140] [Power: 15] [Drones: 2]
        Processes more ore into usable metals. [Process: 160]
        Enhanced Ore Processor [maximum of 2 reached]
        Processes lots of ore into usable metals. [Process: 240]
REPAIR
        Repair Kiosk [maximum of 1 reached]
        A place for drones to get repairs. [MaxServe: 1]
DRONE FACTORY
    [7] Drone Replicator     [Cost: 40] [Power: 5] [Drones: 1]
        Builds new drones on-site.
        Drone Accelerated Production Center [maximum of 1 reached]
        Builds new drones on-site faster.
CONTROL
        Transmission Tower [maximum of 4 reached]
        Allows the central coordinator to control one more drone. [MaxDrones: 1]
        Drone Uplink Relay [maximum of 4 reached]
        Allows the central coordinator to control more drones. [MaxDrones: 2]
    [8] Drone Routing Array  [Cost: 80] [Power: 15] [Drones: 0]
        Allows the central coordinator to control even more drones. [MaxDrones:
5]

destroy
Do you wish to destroy the building at your current location? (a recharge kiosk)
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
A recharge kiosk gracefully crumples into scrap metal upon engaging its
self-destruct routine.
A recharge kiosk has been destroyed.

peer lounge
You peer into a transparisteel doorway into the pilot lounge...
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
You can go out.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is loaded onto an
automated flatbed and slowly moved into a large garage.
Your ship 'William Dove' has been automatically moved into a garage.
A sanitation drone turns and slowly plods into a transparisteel doorway into the
pilot lounge.

Demarco,
I'm sorry to hear about the loss of your ship. If there is anything I can do to
help, let me know. I do, however, have your ship's salvage container on my desk
should you want it. I saw it on the landing pad and didn't want the sanitation
drones to destroy it. What ever happened, don't let this discourage you from
combat. It happens to the best of us. All we can do is try to learn from the
experience. Take care and fly safe.
Best Regards,
Shule

from the various starship systems.
launch
You begin the launch sequence.

wait.

You notify flight control of your desire to land.

transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
power

The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out

out
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The vostok-class capsule "Shooting Star" and the scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard
Scout Delta-2" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
The vostok-class capsule "Shooting Star" is loaded onto an automated flatbed and
slowly moved into a large garage.
You can't go that way.
d
You notice a bright flash of light above; a starship must be coming in for a
landing.

The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

[Teslatown; Spaceport Landing Pad]

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Site 129294953; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Site 129294953; Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
This is a large dark tunnel, exactly like the hundreds of others that permeate
this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

[Teslatown; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The one-person cargo hauler "The Fall Of Atlantis", the two-person Accord gemini
"Sg 8", the four-person mule "ShadowHawk", the opochtli "Mouse Noise (Squeak Was
Taken)", the two-person Accord gemini "Nebula Flame", the two-person Accord
gemini "Javelle", the two-person Accord gemini "Infinite Joy", the one-person
fighter "Until It Breaks", the two-person Accord gemini "Remember What I Said",
the four-person mule "Stinger", the one-person cargo hauler "Sprouting Wings",
and the four-person mule "Lidia's Pride" are landed here.
You see a battlesuit transportation technician here.
You can go east.
Your battlesuit is automatically transferred to the spaceport.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n
You move north.
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
You can go north and south.
You move into the area.
commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
f......................................................Heavy Laser Cutter
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
pu.....................................................Pulse              
(Stuns a single target.)
scr....................................................Scramble           
(Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.)
rv.....................................................Reverb             
(Damages a single target over time.)
ss.....................................................Sonic Slam         
(Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.)
wv.....................................................Sonic Wave         
(Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.)
mn.....................................................Minor Repair       
(Slightly repairs a single target.)
reg....................................................Regenerate         
(Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.)
mg.....................................................Minor Group Repair 
(Slightly repairs your entire squad.)
pre....................................................Preemptive Repair  
(Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.)
mdr....................................................Moderate Repair    
(Repairs a single target.)
res....................................................Squad Restoration  
(Grants the squad very slow generative repair.)
mdg....................................................Moderate Group
Repair(Repairs your entire squad.)
shk....................................................Shake Off          
(Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.)
gp.....................................................Group Pulse        
(Stuns a group of targets.)
mjr....................................................Major Repair       
(Greatly repairs a single target.)
fl.....................................................Flare              
(Attracts attention from a group of enemies.)
fls....................................................Flash              
(Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop what
they were doing.)
cf.....................................................Confuse            
(Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.)
mjg....................................................Major Group Repair 
(Greatly repairs your entire squad.)
de.....................................................Advanced Resource
Detection(Scans for various resources.)
rex....................................................Accelerated Rare Earths
Extraction(Extracts rare earths from the ground.)
ext....................................................Bulk Mineral
Extraction(Extracts minerals from the ground.)
art....................................................Simple Artifact
Extraction(Extracts artifacts from the ground.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

[Site 129294953; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

what they were doing.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds

   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds

   Module:     Minidrone

friendly minidrones in their work.

   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds

   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds

   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds

   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds

   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE

   Module:     Sonics

[Teslatown; North Gate] (inside a battlesuit)
A very tall, heavy metal archway stands at the exit of Teslatown, leading out
into the harsh landscape beyond, where one's environmental suit is their only
protection against frequent electromagnetic ministorms and constant scorching
heat.
You can go south.

You press a button on an AEU Combat Universalist, which splits open down the

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

You move north.

[Site 129294953; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Site 129294953; Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
This is a large dark tunnel, exactly like the hundreds of others that permeate
this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.
Markings on the ground show that this area has already been explored.
You see the wreckage of Poacher Drone Alpha, a one-use repair drone, and a
one-use repair drone here.
You can go northwest and down.

n
You press a button on an AEU Combat Universalist, which splits open down the
front. You carefully climb inside.
n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

[Site 154813926; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Site 154813926; Entry Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand at the entrance to a subterranean tunnel. The radiation level is
somewhat reduced here. Deeper in the tunnel, you can expect to find mineral
deposits and perhaps one or two alien artifacts, from whichever species occupied
this world before humanity established a presence.

this world. The stone above blocks some of the incoming radiation, but the heat
level increases quickly as the tunnels wind into the depths of the planet.

n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

[Site 154813926; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

You press a button on an AEU Combat Universalist, which splits open down the
front. You carefully climb inside.
n
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

[Site 154813926; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

into the harsh landscape beyond, where one's environmental suit is their only
protection against frequent electromagnetic ministorms and constant scorching
heat.

tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.
You see a silver-haired Tesla scientist here.
You can go east, southwest, west, and northwest.

clearance under the AEU-EAOS non-aggression pact."

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.

You press a button on a League Knight, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n
You move north.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
n
You move north.

[Site 154813926; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
f alpha
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You see Poacher Drone Alpha here.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
ca.....................................................Cylinder Accelerator
f......................................................Powered Shotgun
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
fl.....................................................Flare              
(Attracts attention from a group of enemies.)
fls....................................................Flash              
(Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop what
they were doing.)
ill....................................................Illuminate         
(Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.)
rad....................................................Radiate            
(Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.)
lg.....................................................Laser Guidance     
(Augments your squad's accuracy.)
bl.....................................................Blind              
(Blinds a single target for a period of time.)
df.....................................................Directed Flare     
(Irritates and provokes a single target.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Site 154813926; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.

Combat/Support

(Projects a yellow glyph.)

(Projects a red glyph.)

(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
mn.....................................................Minor Repair       
(Slightly repairs a single target.)
reg....................................................Regenerate         
(Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.)
mg.....................................................Minor Group Repair 
(Slightly repairs your entire squad.)
pre....................................................Preemptive Repair  
(Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.)
de.....................................................Advanced Resource
Detection(Scans for various resources.)

[Teslatown; North Gate] (inside a battlesuit)
A very tall, heavy metal archway stands at the exit of Teslatown, leading out
into the harsh landscape beyond, where one's environmental suit is their only
protection against frequent electromagnetic ministorms and constant scorching
heat.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.
You see a silver-haired Tesla scientist here.
You can go east, southwest, west, and northwest.
You move west.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
ca.....................................................Cylinder Accelerator
f......................................................Powered Shotgun
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
mn.....................................................Minor Repair       
(Slightly repairs a single target.)
reg....................................................Regenerate         
(Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.)
mg.....................................................Minor Group Repair 
(Slightly repairs your entire squad.)
pre....................................................Preemptive Repair  
(Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.)
de.....................................................Advanced Resource
Detection(Scans for various resources.)
ext....................................................Bulk Mineral
Extraction(Extracts minerals from the ground.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

indicates people who are out of comm range and cannot hear you over your

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a small seashell pink trash can, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep
purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere
blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed
pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and
light purple cloth rug, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top
here.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a
large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters Block]
This room leads to the living quarters, and contains some additional amenities,
notably a tiny alcove containing a shower. A small keypad controls access to the
living quarters. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, a violet leather
sectional sofa, an antique oak table from Old Earth, a small purple trash bin, a
textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting a white-colored glow),
a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a glossy pale pink ceramic felo chow bowl, a
wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing blue and yellow aquatic
life and multicolored round rocks, a small bubbling neon blue-lit toroidal
aquarium containing blue and red aquatic life and round rocks, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing ivory and fuchsia aquatic life and
sea green and neon blue round rocks, a small orange ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, and Xavier the big silver soldier felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a small seashell pink trash can, a small yellow ball containing a
realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep
purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere
blanket, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed
pillow, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and
light purple cloth rug, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top
here.
You can go out.

[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.

ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
who
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
There appear to be about 20 pilots recently active.

b-67
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer

almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.

to allow for landing procedures will take approximately nineteen seconds."

[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Unmanned Pickup Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Kalliste". The organization has earned 1,947,561.74 credits.
You are charged less in taxes for transferring to a pilot-owned space station.
You have donated one piece of debris to the station's blast furnace.
You have been credited with 7,786,494.70 League credits for your find.
Your income is deferred until the temporary station's storage module is
transferred to a spaceport.

large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.

Accord of Free Worlds.

orion
Which sector did you mean?
[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
#G!*N.6f+!lg6`h^|uEmt$A7%sNsEN^S][f0_~P8
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2580 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Southsouthwest and Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Critical Strike.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

power

from the various starship systems.
sit chair

ftl a-59

launch

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
green

You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Eta-6", the two-person Accord gemini
"Fearless", and the scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Upsilon-0" are landed
here.

[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair and a discount beacon launcher here.

launch

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl tesla
The computer reports that the five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William
Dove" has jumped out of the sector.
The sensors tell you that this area is full of valuable salvage, but all you can
see of it yourself is dark smudges that block the light of the stars.
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
sit chair
You sit up onto a black leather captain's chair.
The planet known as Teslaworld rotates below you, the atmosphere looking as
impenetrable as that of a gas giant. The thick clouds roil with continual
storms, and lightning flashes all across the sky many times a second.
ships
There are no other ships in the sector.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Site 188111811; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.
You see a silver-haired Tesla scientist here.
You can go east, southwest, west, and northwest.
You move west.

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Teslatown; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair and a discount beacon launcher here.
You can go up and out.
(You are sitting on a black leather captain's chair.)

point. Also need to take the scoop to get upgraded."
[General Communication] Evangeline Adaire laughs. "I know, but I feel like
sitting."
[General Communication] Evangeline Adaire transmits, "Oooh, scooping is fun to,
I get sixty million off one currently."
[General Communication] Morris Corlew transmits, "I don't have that kind of
equipment."

[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
