l eva
Evangeline Adaire
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and six inches tall and
has fair, creamy white skin. Her body is athletically slim with gently curved
hips and curved, well muscled calves. She has rounded, delicate shoulders and
large breasts. Her face is angular and beautifully sculpted, with a slim, arched
nose and slightly pointed chin. Her lips are full, plump and dark pink and
occasionally part to reveal a set of straight white teeth. Beneath a set of well
sculpted eyebrows, her eyes are emerald green and deep set. Her waist-length,
glossy hair is dark red and wrapped in a single braid interwoven with silver
bells. She has long, well shaped light pink fingernails. She has a small pale
purple lotus in her hair.
A tiny tinkling silver bell on a silver ring pierces her right earlobe and a
tiny tinkling silver bell on a silver ring pierces her left earlobe.
 She is wearing a figure-hugging white dress with a sweetheart neckline and a
brocade bodice and a pair of cross-strapped tan leather sandals. She is also
wearing a gold link bracelet with numerous delicate artist charms, a dark violet
silk Feng Wo coin purse decorated with embroidered emerald dragons, a set of
several dark red stone bangles, a fine gold link necklace with a radiant pale
purple crystal rose pendant, a violet touch einrophone in a lavender reinforced
plastic phone holster, a compact metallic royal purple camera with a gold
fleur-de-lys embossed on the front with a glittery royal purple camera strap, a
delicate gold link bracelet with a single pale purple crystal heart suspended
from it, a pair of shimmering pale purple crystal drop earrings, a slender
bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, and a dark red
engineering tool case. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both biceps, both
elbows, both forearms, both wrists, both hands, both knees, both calves, and
both ankles are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

the starship support fund.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The scout "AEU Navy Honour Guard Scout Omicron-0" and the five-person A.S.S.
tactical platform "William Dove" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
You notice a bright flash of light above; a starship must be coming in for a
landing.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.
[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.
You see a silver-haired Tesla scientist here.
You can go east, southwest, west, and northwest.

[Site 128299872; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

A very tall, heavy metal archway stands at the exit of Teslatown, leading out

[Teslatown; Faraday Plaza] (inside a battlesuit)
Faraday Plaza is so named for the immense spherical Faraday cage that stretches
over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange. A tall kiosk displaying mission postings stands in the very center of
the plaza.
You can go north, east, south, and west.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.
You move north.

[Site 117898177; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.
You can go north and south.

Author: Klaus Stein
Posted: 01:16 10 July 2316 GST
--

the blueprint to make the robots themselves. If anyone has one lying around or
comes across one, let me know so we can work something out.

[Site 186561242; Surface] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand on the surface of Teslaworld. The levels of radiation and magnetic
flux here play havoc with your battlesuit's electronics, obscuring all input in
shifting levels of white noise. The sky is obscured by dark purple clouds, which
flash several times a second with bolts of lightning. Markings on the ground
show that this area has already been explored.
You can go down.

[Site 186561242; Entry Tunnel] (inside a battlesuit)
You stand at the entrance to a subterranean tunnel. The radiation level is
somewhat reduced here. Deeper in the tunnel, you can expect to find mineral
deposits and perhaps one or two alien artifacts, from whichever species occupied
this world before humanity established a presence. Markings on the ground show
that this area has already been explored.

to Old Earth.

elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a stretchy long-sleeved light blue top with a colorful dragonfly
print, a pair of skinny faded blue low rise jeans, and a pair of baby blue
leather clogs with a row of multicolored daisies across the toes. She is also
wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender
bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple
wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a
delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold
touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and a
soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

l asteria
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA. It is asleep.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Sassie the sleeping
large fuchsia felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare black
EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on it, a
glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and coral rocks, a small
yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a clear plastic food
storage container, a small white trash bin, a red plastic food storage
container, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, Purr the humanoid
service robot, and Bert the hefty blue soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Morris 'The Moose' Corlew, Mike Marshall, and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go out.
Morris 'The Moose' Corlew asks in an Old Earth accent, "Demarco coming?"
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Demarco Scott transmits, "What's that?"

Lily Kaise kisses you.
